wikipedia_page.main: Raymond Eric Frearson (14 January 1904 – 26 February 1991) was an English cricketer. Frearson was a right-handed batsman who bowled Leg break. He was born in Lincoln, Lincolnshire and he died in Skegness, Lincolnshire.

response: Local sportspeople include Anne Pashley (died 2016), the Olympic athlete and (latterly) opera singer, who was born at Wallace's holiday camp in Skegness in 1935.Mel Watman, "Pashley, Anne", The Oxford Dictionary of National Biography (online ed., Oxford University Press, January 2020). Retrieved 1 July 2020. The footballer Ray Clemence was born in Skegness in 1948.Croft (1986), p. 107. The cricketer Ray Frearson (1904–1991) played for the Skegness team and died in the town.Kime (1986), pp. 106–107."Obituaries in 1991", Wisden Cricketers' Almanack 1992 (ESPNCricinfo). Retrieved 1 July 2020. . Among golfers, Mark Seymour died in Skegness in 1952,"Mark Seymour Dead", Dundee Courier, 20 September 1952, p. 5. and Helen Dobson was born there."Helen Hewlett to Manage GB&I Teams", England Golf, 29 January 2015.
